Package org.apache.shiro.web.faces.tags

Provides the Shiro Facelets Tag Library implementations.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AuthenticatedTag Tag that renders the tag body only if the current user has executed a successful authentication attempt during their current session.
AuthenticationTag Base TagHandler for Tags that check for authentication.
GuestTag Tag that renders the tag body if the current user is not known to the system, either because they haven't logged in yet, or because they have no 'RememberMe' identity.
HasAnyPermissionTag Tag that renders the tag body only if the current user has at least one of the comma-delimited string permissions specified in name attribute.
HasAnyRolesTag Displays body content if the current user has any of the roles specified.
HasPermissionTag Tag that renders the tag body only if the current user has the string permissions specified in name attribute.
HasRoleTag  
LacksPermissionTag  
LacksRoleTag  
NotAuthenticatedTag Tag that renders the tag body only if the current user has not executed a successful authentication attempt during their current session.
PermissionTag Base TagHandler for Tags that check for permissions.
PrincipalTag Tag used to print out the String value of a user's default principal, or a specific principal as specified by the tag's attributes.
RememberedTag Tag that renders the tag body only if the current user's identity (aka principals) is remembered from a successful authentication during a previous session and the user has not executed a successful authentication attempt during their current session.
SecureComponent Base class for JSF components.
SecureTag Base class for all TagHandlers
UserTag Tag that renders the tag body if the current user known to the system, either from a successful login attempt (not necessarily during the current session) or from 'RememberMe' services.
 

Package org.apache.shiro.web.faces.tags Description

Provides the Shiro Facelets Tag Library implementations.

Shiro Facelets Tags can be used to evalute or not evaluate (show or not show) parts of a Facelets page based on the current user's authentication status and/or authorization (access control) abilities.

Based on the original Shiro JSP tags

OBS: These tags are meant to be used with JSF 1.X and Facelets 1.1.X. They will NOT work with JSF 2.

Author:
Deluan
